intro: Acoidium fuscum, commonly known as the dark acoid, is a rare and enigmatic plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, dark green leaves that are typically clustered at the base of the plant. The flowers are small and clustered in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Acoidium fuscum is considered a species of conservation concern.
